full_text: TITLE: Association of Acute Care Surgeon Experience With Emergency Surgery Patient Outcomes and Mortality ABSTRACT: This cohort study compares acute care surgeon experience with selected patient outcomes, including morbidity and mortality. BODY: FindingsIn this cohort study of 772 patients undergoing an emergency surgical procedure at 1 of 5 US academic medical centers, less surgeon experience was associated with increased return to the operating room and postoperative complications. Mortality was similar regardless of surgeon experience.
